page.title: 12OLDEST INHABITANT INTERVIEW
page.content:
Mr Cooper is one of the oldest inhabitants. He has lived in Loxwood all his life. He told us :
I am 84 years old. I used to go to the old Loxwood School. There were eight classes then, two of them were Infants. When I left school I went to work in the army. The First World War was terrible.
Ifold used to be lots of woodland and very damp, but since the 1930's there have been so many houses built.
I remember the Italian Prisoners of War who were made to work on the farms during the Second World War. Some of them tried to escape and hid in Devil's Hole, a natural hollow near the Wey and Arun Canal.
